text.content:
Short Rest

Source: XPHB, page 373

A Short Rest is a 1-hour period of downtime, during which a creature does nothing more strenuous than reading, talking, eating, or standing watch. To start a Short Rest, you must have at least 1 Hit Points|XPHB|Hit Point. When you finish the rest, you gain the following benefits:• You can spend one or more of your Hit Point Dice|XPHB to regain Hit Points|XPHB. For each Hit Point Dice|XPHB|Hit Point Die you spend in this way, roll the die and add your Constitution modifier to it. You regain Hit Points|XPHB equal to the total (minimum of 1 Hit Point). You can decide to spend an additional Hit Point Dice|XPHB|Hit Point Die after each roll. • Some features are recharged by a Short Rest. If you have such a feature, it recharges in the way specified in its description.A Short Rest is stopped by the following interruptions:• Rolling Initiative|XPHB • Casting a spell other than a cantrip • Taking any damage An interrupted Short Rest confers no benefits.
